description: Red berry, pressed violet, tilled earth and new leather are some of the aromas you'll find on this. On the concentrated palate, notes of licorice, clove and tobacco accent a core of black cherry set against a backbone of firm fine-grained tannins. A coffee note wraps up the finish.

title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Herdade de São Miguel Escolha dos Enólogos Red (Alentejano)
description: A blend of the winemakers' two favorite vats, this is intended to give the best impression of the vintage. It's bold, ripe and full of dark fruit and big tannins. With nine months of barrel age, it has filled out and will be ready to drink from 2019.
designation: Herdade de São Miguel Escolha dos Enólogos

title: Castello Romitorio 2012 Filo di Seta  (Brunello di Montalcino)
description: Aromas of red berry, espresso, underbrush and French oak lead the nose along with a balsamic note. The bright, sleek palate evokes wild cherry, crushed raspberry, pipe tobacco and licorice alongside tightly knit, fine-grained tannins that lend refined support. Drink 2020–2028.

title: Château Lamartine 2014 Expression Malbec-Tannat (Cahors)
description: The combination of two naturally tannic grapes has inevitably produced a tannic wine. But the ripe layer of rich black fruits acts as a foil to the density of the wine and gives it both balance and a good future. This is a serious wine that needs to age, so drink from 2020.

title: Cuda Ridge Wines 2013 Reserve Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: Fascinating earthy, spicy aromas and flavors give an extra dimension to this full-bodied and richly textured wine. New leather, cardamom, and cumin scents infuse the aroma, while ripe but not sweet black currant, dark cherry and clove flavors flood the palate. It's rich enough to enjoy now but will be best after 2019.

title: Domaine Bousquet 2015 Grande Reserve Malbec (Tupungato)
description: Tarry aromas of blackberry and freshly applied asphalt set up a full-bodied palate with sandpaper tannins. Blackberry and toast flavors taste a little burnt, while an oak-based blackened element is present on a stout finish. Drink this blocky and lusty Malbec through 2023.

title: Domdechant Werner 2015 Hochheimer Kabinett Riesling (Rheingau)
description: A shower of crushed minerals lends transparency to this fleshy dry Riesling. It's bold in body and alcohol, heaving lusciously with ripe tangerine, peach and nectarine flavors, but zesty acidity adds levity. The finish is warm and smoky but long and languorous.

title: Dujac Fils & Pere 2014  Gevrey-Chambertin
description: A fine blend of ripe fruit and crisp red berry flavors, this negociant wine produced by Domaine Dujac is structured and generous. The bright acidity reflects the vintage while the structure and tannins reflect the appellation. Together, they will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2019.

title: Eric Kent 2014 Small Town Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Rich in rose scents, this is an extremely light, crisply textured wine, with subtle pomegranate, tart cherry and orange flavors. Silky and delicate, it offers a wealth of acidity.

title: Georges Vigouroux 2014 Château de Mercuès Malbec (Cahors)
description: The flagship estate of the Vigouroux family, this medieval castle on a hill is also a hotel. The vineyard produces powerful wines like this, packed with dusty tannins and with dark berry fruits and fine concentration. It is a wine to age, drink from 2020.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015  Pernand-Vergelesses
description: This comes from an underrated appellation, in the shadow of the Corton-Charlemagne vineyard. It's touched lightly by wood aging, showing ripe yellow fruit and a cool streak of minerality. Still young, it's developing well and will be ready to drink from 2018.

title: Kaiken 2013 Mai Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Black in color, this smells of olive, eucalyptus and tarry berry, much like you'd get from a high-end Chilean red. An extracted massive palate is dense and layered, while this tastes of salty black plum and black currant. A toasty smooth finish with mild tannins is herbal and balsamic. Drink through 2021.

title: Lang & Reed 2015 Chenin Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Silky and voluptuous, this is a compelling example of the rare variety being able to shine in the Napa Valley when put in the right hands. From a small vintage (only the second for this wine), it shines in peach, green apple and honey flavors, chased by crisp acidity.

title: Okapi 2013 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Big, rich and rewarding, this wine opens with a bouquet of honeysuckle and apple blossom. It offers high acidity and robust oak in equal, complementary measure, as melon, apple and caramel flavors weigh in the smoothly textured palate.

title: ONX 2014 Crux Red (Templeton Gap District)
description: Dark purple fruit is upstaged by the strong umami character on the nose of this blend of 41% Syrah, 32% Mourvèdre and 27% Grenache, reminiscent of soy, shiitake mushroom and beef jerky. There is a rustic and gamy quality to the dark berry-laced palate, with meat, leather and spice qualities, lifted by a touch of licorice.

title: Psagot 2014 Peak Red
description: Aromas of blackberry, strawberry and chocolate open for flavors of blackberry, Red Delicious apple peel, aniseed and vanilla. This wine is harmonious on the palate with understated tannins and breakthrough notes of summer peach on the finish.

title: Puramun 2014 Reserva Malbec (Valle de Uco)
description: Potent, inky aromas of blackberry and licorice reflect this beefy Malbec's opaque black color. In the mouth, this is energetic and not just heavy and extracted. Lightly salted black-fruit flavors are lifted by acidity, while this finishes deep and strong. Drink through 2022.

title: Quinta do Portal 2014 Reserva Red (Douro)
description: This reserve wine is a ripe and smooth blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca. New wood aging for nine months has brought out the ripeness of the fruit and added a spicy edge. Still young, its black fruit and structure need further developing. Drink from 2019.

title: Quinta Dona Matilde 2011 Red (Douro)
description: An old vine field blend from the family-owned estate, this wine is dense with both tannin and ripe black fruit. Plum and blackberry flavors are balanced by acidity and chalky texture. Drink now.

title: Recanati 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Upper Galilee)
description: Red-violet in the glass, this wine has a nose of black cherry, cocoa and freshly ground coffee. It is soft on entry, but velvety tannins and flavors of blackberry, vanilla, espresso bean and a soft hint of cocoa powder render it a more sophisticated quaff than first sip would suggest.

title: Château Andron Blanquet 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Rich and sweet, with fresh tannins and solid fruit flavors. The wine is dark, but has vivid acidity.

title: Château Bel-Air Ouÿ 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Owned by Jean-Luc Thunevin of Valandraud, this is an intense - maybe too intense - spicy wine, packed with new wood. There is a juicy character, but structure dominates.

title: Château d'Issan 2009 Barrel sample  (Margaux)
description: 89-91 Barrel sample. The wine has a rustic edge, over very juicy fruit, very blackcurrant, and with a high acid content. It feels light.

title: Château du Domaine de l'Eglise 2009 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)
description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Solid, but still fresh wine, good acidity, some sweetness, but more pure blackcurrant and berry fruits.

title: Château Haut-Bergey 2009 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 89-91 Barrel sample. A definite burnt character on the nose, but the fruit has proper richness, the wood perhaps showing too much high toast. The freshness should be kept and not lost in the wood.

title: Château la Tour de Pin Figeac 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Sweet fruit, soft tannins, ripe wine. The structure takes a while to show with dusty, almost velvet tannins.
winery: Château la Tour de Pin Figeac

title: Château Puy-Blanquet 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Powerful, but smooth, with ripe milk chocolate and sweetness. Very velvet in texture, with just enough acidity.

title: Le Nardian 2009 Barrel sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Very fresh. With just a light touch of wood spice, and a great burst of citrus, grapefruit, a little lychee from Muscadelle.

title: Château Bonalgue 2009 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)
description: 89-91 Barrel sample. A solid chunky sweet wine, with lots of ripe bright fruits, and vivid blackcurrants. With this structure it will age.

title: Château Bouscaut 2009 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 89-91 Barrel sample. A full-bodied wine that lacks some definition. It has fatness, weight, but the freshness is not all there.

title: Château Grand Barrail Lamarzelle Figeac 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 89-91 Barrel sample. A smooth wine, almost velvet, very polished. The fruits are ripe, sweet, very soft.

title: Château Latour-Martillac 2009 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Very ripe fruit aromas, the fruit ripe, full of sweetness, showing signs of super maturity.

title: Château Haut-Carles 2009 Barrel sample  (Fronsac)
description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Light, ripe, fresh with pleasant acidity and the freshest of blackcurrants.

title: Château Haut-Simard 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 88-90 Barrel sample. This is rich, with sweet fruits and delicious sweet plum flavors, good tannins, a lovely juicy character.

title: Château Malescot Saint-Exupery 2009 Barrel sample  (Margaux)
description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Packed, fruity wine, dominated by very fresh acidity. The wine is crisp as much as rich, maybe on the lean side.

title: Château Montviel 2009 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)
description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Ripe and sweet, plush fruit, balanced sufficiently with acidity and some firm tannic character. The wine is chunky, but there is balance.

title: Château Plince 2009 Barrel sample  (Pomerol)
description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Some spice here, from the rich Merlot. The wine has ripe blackberry, sweet fruits as well as concentrated tannins.

title: Château Anthonic 2009 Barrel sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)
description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Very soft, rounded wine, the tannins a mere hint as the fruit rolls forward. Fine, juicy spice.

title: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2009 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)
description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Very apply wine, with light botrytis character, some spice and very fresh fruit. It is bright and almost crisp.

title: Château de Lamarque 2009 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 88-90 Barrel sample. There is a high level of new wood, toast that dominates both the aroma and the flavors. It gives the wine a hard-edged feel at this stage.

title: Château Lafon-Rochet 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Sweet vanilla aroma, fruit that is ripe, soft, fleshy. This seems to have suffered from super-mature, fruit, although a final juiciness does help.

title: Château Teyssier 2009 Barrel sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Dark bitter chocolate coated wine, soft in texture, but with a good stalky chewy edge. Final flavors are of cedar, new wood and spice.

title: Marojallia 2009 Barrel sample  (Margaux)
description: 88-90 Barrel sample. A hugely extracted wine, very dark and tannic, solid, spicy wood.

title: Château Beaumont 2009 Barrel sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Lots of spiced wood, with sweet blackberry fruits. The wine is initially soft, but the tannins do kick in. The fruit finally has great freshness

title: Zanoni 2007 Zovo  (Amarone della Valpolicella)
description: On the bold and powerful side, this deals lush flavors of dark chocolate, chewy cherry, leather, tobacco and barbecue smoke. Packed with intensity and soft richness, it also delivers a fine point of fresh acidity on the finish.

title: Zocker 2011 Paragon Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Edna Valley)
description: This tastes sweeter than the very fine 2009 and 2010, but that may be because the fruit is so powerfully intense and pure. It has flavors of ripe tangerines, limes, peaches and apples, made racy by its acidity. No oak has been applied, so the wine tastes fresh.

title: Gratallops 2007 Partida Bellvisos Red (Priorat)
description: Compared to the excellent 2006, this wine is heavier, riper and jammier at every check point. The nose is baked and raisiny, while the palate feels saturated to the extreme and gritty as well. The primary flavors run toward baked plum and blackberry, while licorice, leather and raisin notes carry the finish. Give this lots of air after opening, about an hour or so.

title: Oakville East 2009 Exposure Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This is hard to appreciate now because the fruit is so primary and upfront—like a heaping spoon of black raspberry jam—and also because the tannins are thick and tough. There's something almost rustic about it. On the other hand, six years or more in the cellar could reward. Made from Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, with a splash of Petit Verdot.

title: Standing Stone 2010 Vidal Ice Vidal Blanc (Finger Lakes)
description: Intensely aromatic with notes of orange blossom, honeysuckle and candied orange peel, this balances ripe tropical fruit and creamy butterscotch flavors with a shower of lemonade acidity. Made using grapes that were frozen post-harvest.

title: Atalaya 2010 La Atalaya Garnacha-Monastrell (Almansa)
description: Big, smoky and concentrated on the nose, this has a ton of black fruit and char notes. This is mouth-filling, deep and powerful stuff, with a potent mash of baked blackberry, molasses and barbecue sauce filling in the flavor profile. It finishes long and roasted, with savory oak and saucy spice flavors. A blend of 85% Garnacha and 15% Monastrell.

title: Zymè 2008  Valpolicella Classico Superiore
description: This offers beautiful intensity and staying power. Layer after layer peels away to reveal black fruit, spice, leather, tobacco and cured meat notes. The soft, velvety mouthfeel would pair with pork, lamb or veal.

title: La Chablisienne 2010 Les Vénérables  (Chablis)
description: While the wine seems at first rich, it then shows a tautly acidic character that gives a refreshing character to the roundness. That steely acidity is what defines the tight, crisp finish.

title: Le Bertarole 2008 Podere Le Marognole  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: Modern and oak driven, this has aromas of toasted almond, chocolate, tobacco and crushed clove. The fruit nuances tend to be on the dark and jammy side. It gains focus on the palate thanks to its firm structure and bright cola and licorice endnotes.

title: Louis Latour 2010 En Chevret Premier Cru  (Volnay)
description: Rich, round and concentrated, this is developing fast. The acidity is already comfortably embedded in the ripe red-berry fruit..

title: Francine et Olivier Savary 2010  Chablis
description: This is a rich mouthful of a wine, with ripe notes of red apple and green plum. Behind the fruit, there is a soft vanilla edge that adds depth of flavor. It's concentrated and ready to age for 2–3 years.

title: Gino Fasoli 2007 Alteo  (Amarone della Valpolicella)
description: The 17.5% alcohol is a bit much, but the burning effect is dampened by the mouthfeel's extraordinary thickness and richness. It's big and bold, with intense aromas of toasted nut, vanilla, chocolate fudge, blackberry jam and exotic spice.

title: Giuseppe Campagnola 2008 Caterina Zardini Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: Compared to past vintages, this edition of Caterina Zardini Riserva shows slightly pungent aromas of red apple, plum, cherry and cassis. The bright fruit gives the wine support and endurance, which is further reinforced by the soft, velvety mouthfeel

title: Glenora 2011 Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Fragrant yellow and purple flowers on the nose and palate of this medium-sweet Riesling add a subtle perfume to all of the ripe, luscious white-peach and nectarine flavors. Hints of wet stone and lime-like acidity lend a crisp, tonic tone to the midpalate, extending onto the long, lingering finish.

title: Tedeschi 2010 Capitel San Rocco  (Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso)
description: Tedeschi is one of the benchmark producers of Valpolicella. This wine is bursting with fresh fruit intensity and lush background notes of spice, leather and moist pipe tobacco.

title: Blue Plate 2011 Dry Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)
description: This bottling is even better than the 2010: drier, crisper and more elegant, without a trace of sweetness. It's balanced, with a long finish that should pair well with any kind of spiced food.

title: Bolla 2007  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
description: This offers vibrant aromas of red cherry, blackberry, leather, spice and cigar box. There are dark touches of resin and brown sugar that are followed by notes of smoked bacon and cured meat. This is dark, masculine and concentrated.

title: Cesari 2010 Mara  (Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso)
description: This offers a slightly less formal and austere expression compared to Cesari's Bosan. Perfect for chicken or pork roast, this delivers fresh acidity beyond the tones of cherry, cola, leather and barbecue spice.

title: Chandon NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (California)
description: While this bubbly is technically dry, it tastes sweetly infused with the essence of strawberries and vanilla. The mouthfeel is fine, with a gentle scouring of acidity and the slight sourness from its lees. Drink it now with almost anything, especially sushi.

title: Chanson Père et Fils 2009  Gevrey-Chambertin
description: Concentrated and complex, this has structure and acidity, with a black cherry flavor. It's a ripe, powerful wine that could become more generous as it ages.

title: Chanson Père et Fils 2009  Pommard
description: This shows the richness of the vintage in its ripe red fruits. It has weight as well as tannins, with a solid, firmly structured base of red plum fruit.

title: Degani 2009 La Rosta  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)
description: This shows sweet, plush fruit aromas, with background tones of leather and tobacco. By no means is this wine over the top, in fact, it shows a firm but elegant quality throughout.

title: Domaine A. Machard de Gramont 2010 Les Damodes Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: For a Premier Cru, this is surprisingly open and ready. It has a light structure, offering delicious, forward, juicy fruit that has been rounded out by wood aging. With its ripe character, it will be ready to drink in a year.

title: Domaine Vrignaud 2010 Les Champréaux  (Chablis)
description: A rich, yet finely structured wine, this is full of acidity and bright green and yellow fruits. It's delicious, mouth-filling and refreshing, touched by notes of wood and citrus, with a smooth, toasty finish.

title: Ramón Bilbao 2008 Limited Edition Crianza  (Rioja)
description: This is leathery and earthy up front, with cherry and berry aromas that come with a flower accent. It feels snappy, alert and slightly citrusy, with raspberry, red plum and vanilla flavors. It's relatively short and choppy on the finish, but it's fresh, with the proper amount of oak.

title: Lone Birch 2011 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)
description: With balance and grip, this lightly effervescent wine rolls from a pretty pear flavor into a light tropical fruit note. It's hard to beat at this price.

title: Undurraga 2008 Sibaris Reserva Especial Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: A little murky and muddled on the nose, this has an earthy-berry aroma, with a hint of floral-based perfume. It offers acidity and solidity on the palate, which is backed by standard black-fruit flavors, with undertones of vanilla and raw oak. Very good, but it's a bit oaky.

title: Wait Cellars 2009 Devoto Garden Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: This has flavors of cherry and blackberry jam, cola and spice. It's crisp in acidity and dry, as Pinot should be. This is direct and polished; it's not likely to get better with age, so drink now.

title: Viña Requingua 2010 Toro de Piedra Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: Solid blackberry, cassis and cola aromas are an invitation to enjoy this straightforward, well-made Cabernet that's lively and bouncy, with berry and black currant flavors that match the bouquet. Short on complexity but long on fruit.

title: Hug 2009 el Pape Red (Central Coast)
description: This Rhône-style blend of Grenache, Mourvèdre and Syrah has plenty of cherry and mocha deliciousness. It seems a bit sweet on the finish, so drink it with compatible foods, like bacon.

title: Château Moulin de Clotte 2009  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux
description: Soft, warm and smoky wine, this has a finely layered wood flavor to go with the black currant and red berry fruits. It's dry, yet warm and ripe, finishing with freshness.

title: Clos La Chance 2011 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)
description: There's lots of spicy richness in this slightly sweet Sauvignon Blanc. With zesty acidity, its flavors veer toward pineapples, limes, melons and vanilla. This should be versatile with all kinds of foods.

title: Conway 2009 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: This is very rich, ripe and oaky, but a little over the top, with strong flavors of buttered toast, caramel, orange jam and spice. An outgoing wine crafted in the popular style.

title: Cornarea 2009 Cornarea  (Roero)
description: The bouquet offers intensity and character, with subtle accents of crème de cassis and toasted almond.

title: Gerovassiliou 2007 Avaton Red (Epanomi)
description: This offers aromas and flavors of plum, savory spice and cigarbox, with an overall dry and focused character. A smoky spice note finishes the wine. Pair this with grilled lamb, pizza or steak.

title: Dusted Valley 2009 Petite Sirah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Heavy accents of vanilla and black tea as well as sharp acids and drying tannins characterize this Petite Sirah. If you like your reds big, brawny and oak soaked, this is your poster child.

title: Eagle Eye 2007 Alpha Wolf Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: The flavors of this Cabernet are enormously rich. Blackberry and blueberry jam, black currant, dark chocolate and cassis come in waves. Few wines on earth are this ripe. The issue is balance and complexity, both of which could be stronger. Drink over the next few years.

title: Franciscan 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This shows classic Oakville tannins, acidity and rich blackberry and cassis flavors, with a nice, spicy finish. But, it doesn't show the flashy concentration or the ageworthiness of the region's best Cabernets. Give it a decanting and drink up.

title: Gård 2009 Lawrence Vineyards Don Isidro Red Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A popular 70% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Syrah blend, this sports a distinctive floral note, like a whiff of baby powder. Light cherry fruit anchors the core, remaining balanced throughout the medium finish.

title: Germano Angelo 2008 Mondoca Dardi  (Barolo)
description: Ripe and concentrated, this has a thick, extracted appearance and abundant aromas of cherry liqueur and chocolate. There's a touch of sweet candied fruit on the finish.

title: Giacomo Grimaldi 2008 Sotto Castello di Novello  (Barolo)
description: This wine opens with aromas of leather, old spice and candied fruit that seem past their prime. There's a sour note on the finish.

title: 75 Wine Co. 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: Made in the New Zealand-style, this savory Sauvignon Blanc has bright acidity highlighting racy flavors of citrus, green melon and lemongrass.

title: VML 2011 Rosé of Pinot Noir Rosé (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a strongly flavored blush, packing a punch of raspberry, fig, sweet tea and rose flavors. It's dry and very crisp in acidity. Give it a chill and enjoy with salted, smoked meats, or a nice fish stew.

title: Villa Sparina NV Brut Sparkling (Piedmont)
description: From the Gavi area of northern Italy, this light sparkler opens with dry aromas of pressed flower and citrus, with slightly softer tones of peach and melon to follow on the palate.

title: Mony 2009 Reserve Dry Red Cabernet Sauvignon (Samson)
description: This medium-weight selection offers concentrated aromas and flavors of black currant and blackberry laced with accents of pepper and earthy spice. There's a bit of bite to the moderate tannins, while hints of tobacco leaf and cocoa nib spice up the finish.

title: Pascal Jolivet 2010 Attitude Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)
description: More fragrant than herbaceous, this is a rounded, creamy wine. It has creamed pear, apricot and ripe lime flavors to go with the smooth texture and finish.

title: Pech Merle 2010 Treborce Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This has a powerful, briary character, with a spicy, high-alcohol kick. It erupts in the mouth, with flavors of wild berry, tobacco, cola, anise and white pepper that should pair well with equally spicy fare, preferably fatty meats and cheeses.

title: Saintsbury 2009 Brown Ranch Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This shows the dried herb character that often characterizes Napa Chardonnay, giving the pineapple and orange flavors an earthiness. It's very dry and crisp in acidity, but it ultimately trades opulence for elegance. Drink now.

title: Schug 2010 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Rich in tropical fruit, apricot and pear flavors, with a buttery, creamy texture, this is a satisfying Chardonnay made in the popular style. Brisk acidity makes it clean and balanced.

title: Silver Palm 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Slight touches of smoked meat, iron, slate, cranberry, raspberry and dried sage show on the nose of this wine. The palate is a bit weak, with tangy strawberry and rust flavors.

title: Domaine du Claouset 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: There is a strongly caramel element to this wine. A tannic edge gives structure, though its fruit is less obvious.

title: Mossback 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Chalk Hill)
description: A generic red wine with 13% Petit Verdot and 10% Merlot, there's a thread of rich, ripe red fruit at the heart of this wine, which is medium bodied if not on the lean side, finishing simply. French, Hungarian and American oak did the aging.

title: Oak Farm 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This oaky wine smells like baking spices and tastes almost sweet. It has jammy fruit flavors, warm vanilla and cinnamon accents, a soft texture and vanilla echoes on the finish.

title: Lawer 2015 Rosé of Syrah (Knights Valley)
description: Entirely varietal, and given five months to gel in stainless steel, this is a dark copper-red wine that's noticeably earthy on the nose. Dry, woody and a touch sour in cherry and strawberry, it should be enjoyed chilled and with ceviche.

title: Limited by Cambridge Cellars 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)
description: Fairly light in the glass, juicy aromas of fruit punch, red cherry and licorice show on the nose of this wine. The palate offers pomegranate fruit and fennel, proving quite fruit punchy all around.

title: Torres 2012 Escaleras de Empedrado Pinot Noir (Maule Valley)
description: Scattered aromas of horseradish, cotton candy and vinegar are all over the map but don't convey varietal character or purity. This new wine from terraced vineyards in deep, rural Maule feels clipped, with heavy tannins. Mixed berry flavors are bitter and rubbery, and the finish is grabby and awkward. This is a first release; suffice it to say it needs more work to justify its price.

title: Apaltagua 2015 Reserva Rosé (Maule Valley)
description: Super light in color, with aromas of grape skins, nectarine and briny seashell, this rosé from Carmenère feels highly citric and shearing. Sour-leaning flavors of tangerine and lemon finish with tang and enamel-peeling acidity.

title: Byington 2014 Ventana Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Extremely grassy on the nose, this also shows lime juice and a skunky cannabis character that starts to blow off with time. The texture is racy on the palate, but the grassy component proves rather sour and one-dimensional.

title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Domaine des Bellugues Rosé (Mediterranée)
description: Named after the lightning bugs (bellugues means spark) that lived in the nearby woods, this wine is all fresh fruit and soft texture. There is a hint of caramel to go with the bright acidity and red currant fruits. The wine is a great apéritif style.

title: 3 Badge Beverage 2014 Gehricke Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine reminds one of salty apple pie, with big, drying oak and a whiff of potpourri. Given nine months in 25% new French oak, it holds on to that toasty taste through the finish, with a sprinkling of bitter lemon.

title: Bota Box 2015 Moscato (California)
description: Light aromas turn to vivid floral and fruity flavors in this semisweet and light-bodied wine. It's low in acidity and should taste quite nice with wedding cake, seriously.

title: Case Bianche 2015 Barone Beneventano del Bosco White (Sicilia)
description: This blend of Inzolia and Chardonnay has subdued aromas of orchard fruit and nut. The simple palate offers lime and citrus zest alongside brisk acidity.

title: Château Toutigeac 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This wine is tightly textured, firm and with a strongly tannic element. It will be better with food.

title: Chloe 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Aged in both French and American oak, this is a tropical and oaky expression of the grape, round and slightly sweetened atop a silkiness of smooth butter.

title: La Clarine Farm 2014 Jambalaia Rouge Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine has potent berry, funky earth and herb aromas. Its fruity-floral flavors are tinged with a balsamic nip and a tart, rather tannic mouthfeel. To taste a little pioneering in terms of wine style, don't be alarmed at the sediment in the bottle.

title: Mano A Mano 2013 Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Jumbled, earthy aromas suggest pork and beans. This feels hard and choppy, with drying tannins. Baked, stewy, saucy flavors finish peppery and minty, with unyielding hard tannins.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Montes 2014 Twins Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: Heavy aromas of oak, char and syrupy berry fruits don't smell entirely natural. This feels tannic and scratchy, with missing parts. The flavor of candied, sweet, dominating oak is front and center, while mint, carob and stewed berry flavors finish this off.

title: Pelvillain Frères 2014 Zee Original Malbec (Côtes du Lot)
description: The wine is perfumed and full. It is so soft, missing tannins, and already easy to drink. Black fruits are super-ripe and generous. Drink now.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2013 Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)
description: The wine is so soft that only the light wood flavors give it shape. It is smooth with red plum fruits that are rounded and sweet in style. Acidity seems to be an afterthought. Drink now.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014 Les Enfants Terribles Chardonnay (Pays d'Oc)
description: Soft and fruity, this is a rounded, simple wine. It has apple and light spice and a gentle texture that is already approachable. Juicy and fresh, not a wine for aging, it is ready to drink now.

title: Jelly Jar 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lake County)
description: This extreme wine has vivid earthy aromas like wood smoke and cured meats and equally smoky, meaty flavors. The mouthfeel is quite dry and tannic, and any fruit flavors take a back seat to the gamey character.

title: Tololo 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)
description: Stalky, gritty aromas don't stir much optimism. This feels dry, hard and tannic, while salty, herbal, horsey red-berry flavors finish with some moderate heft and a clampy feel.

title: La Croix du Pin 2012 Cuvée Prestige Medium Sweet Muscat (Pays d'Oc)
description: Pleasant aromas of stone fruit, candied orange peel and white gummy bear waft from the glass and carry through to the round, fruity palate. Ample acidity keep the mouthfeel fresh and the finish clean. Drink up.

title: McManis 2014 Jamie Lynn Vineyard Barbera (California)
description: This wine has strong aromas like wood smoke and grilled beef, then equally smoky, peppery flavors and a tart, rather tannic texture.

title: Montalvo Wilmot 2013 MW Quintos de la Tejera Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Floral, spicy plum aromas come with notes of lemon and chili pepper. This Tempranillo is rudimentary, with a creamy, pasty palate. Baked cherry and berry flavors end with almost syrupy thickness and a touch of chocolate flavor.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Nica 2012 Chardonnay (California)
description: Rich flavors like vanilla and fig combine with a creamy texture and sweet finish to make a cream puff of a wine. The texture is soft and acidity quite low.

title: Producta Vignobles 2015 Cabane aux Oiseaux Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: The caramel character of this wine is less attractive than its background of red fruits. The two sides need to come into balance for it to work completely, so wait until late 2016.

title: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: Lightly salmon-pink in color, this wine is ripe, caramel-flavored and full of red-berry fruits. A zesty orange edge gives the freshness this otherwise full, ripe wine needs.

title: Rio Madre 2014  Rioja
description: Reedy red-fruit aromas lack the clarity that the best wines of this style show. Grabby on the palate, this tastes of basic plum and raspberry. A raw, tannic, rubbery finish is the final act.

title: Nuna 2011 Reserve Torrontés (Salta)
description: Oily and almondy on the nose, but also layered and stacked. Feels lively, jumpy and pumped full of acidity, then tastes of classic lychee and green melon. Full and driving, with citrusy zest to the tail end.

title: Parducci 2009 Small Lot Blend Pinot Noir (California)
description: Good price for a deliciously drinkable Pinot Noir. It's silky and a little sweet in raspberries, brown sugar and bacon flavors. Easy to drink and at this price, it can be your house Pinot.

title: Paul Cluver 2009 Riesling (Elgin)
description: This easy and straightforward white boasts pleasant notes of fresh apple and lemon-lime citrus throughout. The palate is lush but braced with medium acidity that lingers into the close. Enjoy it now.

title: Peter Zemmer 2007 Cortinie Bianco White (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)
description: Cortinie Bianco opens with impressive intensity and lasting aromas of peach cobbler, vanilla cream and preserved peaches. It follows with a smooth, dense texture in the mouth.

title: Primosic 2008 Gmajne Sauvignon (Collio)
description: This light and refreshing Sauvignon from northeast Italy opens with jasmine and floral aromas backed by citrus and stone fruit. Pair this wine with a fresh seafood salad or tuna sushi rolls.

title: Murphy-Goode 2009 Merlot (California)
description: This is the kind of Merlot people will love. It's smooth, soft and silky, with rich, sweet flavors of raspberries and cherries. There's even a candied note of chocolate-covered mint.

title: Nuna 2010 Reserve Bonarda (Mendoza)
description: Lots of fruit is apparent right from the start, with cassis, raspberry, red plum and cotton candy aromas. Lively as can be, but under control, with huge berry flavors touched up by oaky chocolate and vanilla. Not complex but definitely all-out with the berry fruit.

title: Paul Cluver 2009 Pinot Noir (Elgin)
description: Approachable now with an enticing mocha streak throughout that's lifted by the bright red cherry and raspberry fruit flavors. Low tannins and medium acidity make this an easy-pleaser for fans of the grape.

title: Rock Wall 2010 Obsidian Red (Red Hills Lake County)
description: Rock Wall seems to release its wines pretty young, and this too could use a little time. A blend of half Zinfandel and half Petite Sirah from the obsidian-laden hills of Lake County's Red Hills area, a very promising spot for Cabernet in particular. Still hugely tannic, this mix is yummy in dusty black fruit, leather and dark chocolate.

title: Valentino Butussi 2010 Sauvignon (Colli Orientali del Friuli)
description: Fresh, zesty and clean, this luminous Sauvignon would pair with light, vegetable-based foods or appetizers. The wine's simple flavors include citrus, kiwi, fresh pineapple and green apple.

title: Chateau Molyneaux 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: A minty, light-bodied Cab with plenty of layered texture and flavors of plum.

title: Cobblestone 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: Cobblestone's regular Cabernet is very consistent from year to year, a good wine but not a great one. This 2007 is superfruity, with a blast of blackberries, cola and currants. Drink now–2015.

title: Cobblestone 2009 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: A little pricey for the quality, but still, this is a super-drinkable Chardonnay. It's semi-sweet and brisk in acidity, with a cut of minerality supporting ripe orange, pineapple, vanilla and buttered toast flavors.

title: Coelho 2009 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Pure fruit flavors of cranberry and raspberry, tart and forward, introduce this light and approachable Pinot. Elegant and stylish, without much staying power, it's a good choice for drinking now while your heartier Pinots rest in the cellar.

title: Coelho 2010 Estate Renovação Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: All stainless steel barrel-fermented, this is already a rich gold color and showing soft, quickly maturing apple fruit flavors. The finish carries a hint of toast, and the wine makes a graceful, soft landing. Drink up.

title: Comelli 2010 Amplius Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)
description: Friuli in northeast Italy has the unique soils and climatic conditions for full bodied and sophisticated white wines. This Pinot Grigio offers the easy, approachable qualities we associate with the grape with that added dimension or creaminess that is so characteristic of the region.

title: Corvalle 2010 Rutherford Runway Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: There's a grassiness to this Sauvignon Blanc that suggests the cool vintage that yielded it. At the same time, the lemon and lime flavors make it rich. With no oak, the fruit stars, brightened with crisp, clean acidity. The finish is a little too sweet, which detracts from the score.

title: De Stefani 2010 Tai Tocai (Veneto)
description: Tai (made with 100% Tocai grapes) is a lively white wine with fragrant aromas of yellow rose, honeysuckle and passion fruit. A thick, creamy mouthfeel is loaded tight with rich honey flavors.

title: Eberle 2009 Vineyard Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: A good, everyday wine showing how well Paso Robles ripens Cabernet. It's filled with savory blackberry and cherry flavors that go down nice and easy, leading to a spicy finish. Drink now–2014.

title: Fairvalley 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Stellenbosch)
description: A touch of vanilla and sweet oak graces the brambly black berry aromas and flavors in this wine. Medium weight and round in the mouth with fine tannins and a lively finish. Drink now.

title: Farnese 2010 Casale Vecchio Pecorino (Terre di Chieti)
description: There's an easy, informal quality to this white wine that makes it appropriate to pair with roast chicken or baked fish. The Pecorino grape can often be heavy and buttery, but this expression is surprisingly fresh and zesty instead.

title: Foris 2009 Pinot Noir (Rogue Valley)
description: Foris wines reveal a winemaker with a deft touch on both white wines and Pinot Noir. Nuanced scents and accents of berry, herb, earth and stem come together in this subtle, balanced, and honest wine. There is no fakery or blending trickery to boost the color or tannins.

title: François Lurton 2010 Fumées Blanches Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: From selected vineyards, this is a rich, tropical fruit-flavored wine. It has peach and ripe plum fruits laced with citrus. Smooth and fruity. Drink now.

title: Gigante 2009 Chardonnay (Colli Orientali del Friuli)
description: Gigante offers a not-so-giant expression of Chardonnay with nicely measured aromas of stone or passion fruit, pineapple and white almond. The wine is aged in both wood and stainless steel to achieve more length and density on the finish.

title: Guerra Albano 2009 Sauvignon (Colli Orientali del Friuli)
description: Fresh and tangy with aromas of white flower and tomato leaf, this lively Sauvignon would pair with fried calamari or spicy shrimp cocktail. The mouthfeel is streamlined and tight.

title: Vettori 2009 Manzoni Bianco Manzoni (Colli Trevigiani)
description: Incrocio Manzoni 6.0.13 is a grape variety created by Italian professor Luigi Manzoni in the 1930s and represents a cross between Pinot Bianco and Riesling. This expression shows light, fragrant touches of white flower and stone fruit with medium density on the finish.

title: Albino Armani 2009 Colle Ara Pinot Grigio (Valdadige)
description: Colle Ara opens with a light copper color that reflects the natural hue of the grape skins of Pinot Grigio. The aromas include white almond, grapefruit and peach cobbler and the mouthfeel is fresh but creamy at the same time.

title: Broglia 2009 La Meirana  (Gavi)
description: One of the best qualities of Gavi is that tight, mineral note of talc powder or crushed stone that holds it all together. La Meirana is exemplary in this regard making this crisp wine perfect for fresh spring asparagus or a local Piedmont speciality such as sformati, a blended vegetable flan.

title: Testarossa 2006 Brosseau Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)
description: Testarossa's track record with this wine has been on an upward spiral. The '06 shows the winery's usual deft hand at crafting delicately structured, elegant but powerfully flavored wines. Cherries, black raspberries, currants and blood oranges flood the mouth, ending in a swirl of clove and anise. Best now–2010.

title: Alma Rosa 2006 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Impresses for the body and depth that lifts it into sheer deliciousness. A powerful wine, it's stuffed with pure flavors of black cherries, currants, beef jerky and spicy mu shu plum sauce, all wrapped into thick but finely ground tannins, and brightened with crisp coastal acidity. Beautiful now, and should develop over the next 6 years.

title: Kynsi 2005 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This pretty Pinot Noir is drinking well now, but has the depth to last for a while. It's succulent and forward in black and red currant, Dr. Pepper, clove, smoky vanilla and pepper flavors. Really a beautiful, alluring wine.

title: Von Strasser 2005 Reserve Red (Diamond Mountain District)
description: The very tannic '05 reserve is a blend of Petit Verdot, Cab Sauvignon, Merlot and Cab Franc. It's fleshy and rich in blackberry, cassis and tobacco flavors, with lots of new toasty oak, and there's something meaty, like ground hamburger with a splash of tamari. Utterly delicious and very fine, this low-production bottling should evolve over many years.

title: Testarossa 2006 Fritschen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A beautiful Pinot Noir, lilting, refined and utterly delicious. Testarossa stumbled with the '04, but otherwise their track record is great, and the '06 is right up there with the marvelous '05 and '03. The wine's cherry, licorice and smoky oak flavors are captured in a rewarding texture of silk and satin.

title: Concha y Toro 2005 Don Melchor Cabernet Sauvignon (Puente Alto)
description: This comes across as the best Don Melchor that Concha y Toro has produced, and at $69 it should be. It's very ripe, with oak sitting atop pure cassis and plum aromas. The palate is sweet, juicy and packed with dynamite blackberry and black plum flavors. Dark, chocolaty and long on the finish, with ripe tannins. Drink now or hold for five years.

title: Domaine Alfred 2005 Chamisal Vineyards Califa Syrah (Edna Valley)
description: Here's a dense, dramatic young Syrah. It's potent in black currant, cherry, anise and dark chocolate flavors, with plenty of toasty new oak. But more notable is the structure. Fine, ripely sweet tannins, good acidity and moderate alcohol make it balanced and even ageworthy over the next 6 years.

title: Fontodi 2004 Riserva Vigna del Sorbo  (Chianti Classico)
description: This is an extremely elegant and beautiful wine that is tight and compact while being intense and generous at the same time. It offers luscious notes of ripe cherry, blueberry fruit and piquant highlights that recall Asian spices (10% Cabernet is added to the blend). It has a gorgeous mouthfeel, bright fruit flavors and silky tannins.

title: Arista 2005 Longbow Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Here's a young, hedonistic Pinot that captures the essence of RRV from a perfect vintage. Although it's ripely forward in cherry, pomegranate, Dr. Pepper, red licorice and cinnamon spice flavors, it shows a structural sophistication that elevates the score. Beautiful now, and should improve over the next 6 years.

title: C. Beck 2005 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: A shade less opulent but finer and more structured than the '04. The tannins are as fine as in any Napa cult Cab, yet the flavors are exotic, with tiers of black currants, red cherries, licorice, dark chocolate, violets, pepper, leather and Chinese mu shu plum sauce. Drink now with substantial roasts; should age for a decade.

title: Clarendon Hills 2005 Hickinbotham Syrah (Clarendon)
description: As might be expected from winemaker Roman Bratasiuk, this is a full-bodied, rich Syrah, loaded with dark scents of roast coffee, blueberries and baking spices. Blueberry, menthol and spice flavors dominate the palate, finishing long. Despite the massive richness, there's plenty of elegance, too. Imported by Wine Brokers Unlimited.

title: Landmark 2006 Grand Detour Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: The vineyard sources of Landmark's Grand Detour Pinot have varied, but the wine's quality is as high as ever. Made from five well-regarded properties, the '06 is intricately detailed, with complex flavors of dried cherries, red currants, mocha, licorice, sautéed mushrooms splashed with balsamic and smoky, vanilla-infused oak. The silky texture and spicy finish make it irresistible.

title: Williams Selyem 2006 Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: With a generous bite of acidity, this fine Chardonnay is extremely flavorful. Traditionally one of the winery's top Chards, it's explosive in pineapple, Asian pear, crème brûlée and roasted marshmallow flavors. Finishes in a swirl of creamy, buttery spices.

title: Von Strasser 2005 Post Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Von Strasser has a good track record with this wine, and the '05 is right up there with the best, but be forewarned. It's very tannic. But then, it is from Diamond Mountain. Give it a good 4 years, at least, to throw some sediment and let the rich blackberry and black currant flavors emerge. Should hold well for 15 years.

title: Von Strasser 2005 Rainin Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Very hard in tannins, with a real lockdown astringency in the mouth, this is one for the cellar, and it's a slam dunk that age will reward it. Drily balanced and elegantly constructed, it brims with rich blackberry and black currant flavors, with a fine coating of spicy oak. Best 2012–2018.

title: Mitolo 2006 G.A.M. Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: Already approachable, Mitolo's 2006 G.A.M. should nevertheless age 10–15 years. The aromas are slightly peppery and spicy, accented by hints of smoke, while the flavors are dark and savory, blending cedar, coffee, black olive and cola. The soft tannins amply frame the long, mouthwatering finish.

title: Ramos-Pinto 2006 Duas Quintas Reserva Red (Douro)
description: A deliciously ripe wine, all structure, intense black plum fruits, and sweet licorice and tar flavors. Bringing all these great flavors together are the fresh edge, the tannins and the dense fruits.

title: Talbott 2005 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: This cold-climate vineyard is source to some of the most powerful Chardonnays in California. The '05 shows the massive tropical mango, guava, nectarine, apricot and pineapple flavors the vineyard effortlessly delivers. Almost over the top, it's saved by very crisp acidity.

title: Testarossa 2006 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Despite the pale color, this is a powerful wine. It comes from this famous vineyard that pioneered the Santa Rita Hills. Erupts in the mouth with cherry, currant, licorice, cola and vanilla flavors that finish dry and spicy. The tannic edge suggests ageability, which Pinots from this vineyard are easily capable of. Best now–2012.

title: Concha y Toro 2005 Terrunyo Block: Las Terrazas Cabernet Sauvignon (Pirque)
description: A little rubbery and tough on first sniff, but this pedigreed Chilean Cab settles with airing and soon shows exciting, fully ripe raspberry, cassis and blackberry flavors. The mouthfeel is perfectly cushioned yet intense, and the finish is ripe, smooth and composed. Ready to go now but should hold steady for another three years.

title: Carpineto 2004 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: This is a lovely Riserva with thick and penetrating tones of cherry, spice and cola—the holy trinity of traditional Chianti Classico. The wine is dense, concentrated and intense without being too powerful or overwhelming. It would make an excellent companion to veal in a wine reduction sauce because of the natural succulence and structure.

title: Iron Horse 2006 Estate Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: Right up there with the wonderful '05, Iron Horse's '06 shows the brisk acids and long hangtime flavors the wine is known for. The cherry, currant, licorice, root beer and Provençal herb flavors are rich and savory, leading to a complex finish.

title: Longoria 2006 Cuvée Diana Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is the winery's best Chardonnay blend. It comes mainly from Sanford & Benedict Vineyard, and shows the fine structure associated with the appellation. Juicy acidity firms up the oak-inspired Meyer lemon, crushed pineapple and tangy mineral flavors. Should soften and become more complex over the next six years.

title: MacPhail 2006 Pratt Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Quite a bit lighter in body than MacPhail's other single-vineyard '06s, this one benefits from the elegant structure. With its silky angularity, it offers complex flavors of cherries, raspberries, orange tea, vanilla, cinnamon, cloves and vanilla-rich new oak.

title: Merryvale 2005 Starmont Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Merryvale's '05 is very rich and balanced, and shows fine Napa Cabernet character in the intense focus of cassis, enriched with new French oak. It's not an ager, but showcases very high Napa quality for immediate drinking.

title: Vine Cliff 2006 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is a terrific wine, extremely powerful in fruity flavors. It impresses for its sheer volume. Waves of apricots, nectarines, pears, green apples, butterscotch, buttered toast and smoky, vanilla-tinged oak surf the palate, carried along on a wave of crisp acidity.

title: Williams Selyem 2006 Saralee's Vineyard Cluster Select Late Harvest Gewürztraminer (Russian River Valley)
description: With residual sugar of 22.4%, this dessert wine has fantastically sweet flavors of apricot jam, tangerine marmalade, gingersnap cookie, vanilla and crème brûlée, balanced with crisp acidity. The alcohol is a refreshingly low 9.8%.
designation: Saralee's Vineyard Cluster Select Late Harvest

title: Caparsa 2004 Riserva Doccio a Matteo  (Chianti Classico)
description: Very rich, opulent and ripe with oak-driven aromas of vanilla, chocolate, licorice and spice, this is a dark Riserva with loads of personality and almost impenetrable density. It imparts a smooth, silky feel thanks to the quality of its tannins and ends with a chewy bite of plump cherry.

title: Clarendon Hills 2005 Piggott Range Syrah (Clarendon)
description: Like all of the Clarendon Hills wines, this is packed with intensity. It's full-bodied, with soft tannins and a slightly low-acid, natural feel. Aromas of menthol and roasted meat are backed by hints of blackberry and licorice on the palate and a long, lingering finish. Drink now–2020. Imported by Wine Brokers Unlimited.

title: Pessagno 2006 Griva Vineyard Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)
description: This is a half-bottle of Sauvignon Blanc grown in the Arroyo Seco, one of the best sources in California for crisp white wines. With residual sugar of 18.4%, it's very sweet, but it's not a sugar bomb. You'll find complex flavors of pineapples, apicots, vanilla custard, honey and crème brûlée, backed up with firm acidity that makes the wine finish clean.

title: Sherwood House Vineyards 2010 Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Sweet scents of apple, tropical fruit and sweet butter are layered amid nuances of smoke and toasted oak on this full-bodied, savory Chardonnay. While smoky and dark in profile on the palate, it's maintains crisp apple and lemon flavors through the finish.

title: Terraprima 2010 Massís del Garraf White (Penedès)
description: Ripe but basic on the nose, this has dusty apple and sweet, minerally notes that are not sugary. It feels a little blowsy, but there's ample acidic cut to frame the dry, flavors of melon, green banana and apple. This has a simple finish. A blend of 80% Xarello and 20% Riesling.

title: Domaine de Givaudan 2009 Léa Red (Côtes du Rhône)
description: This wine is light in body for a Côtes du Rhône, elegant and spicy, with silky tannins and hints of cracked pepper on the finish. Enjoy this blend of 70% Grenache and 30% Syrah over the next few years.

title: Fleur Du Cap 2011 Bergkelder Selection Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)
description: Although only 10% of this wine was aged in oak, you can definitely pick up on some of the woody accents—like vanilla and faint toast—that spice up core of green apple flesh and melon rind. Medium bodied and balanced, a sweet spice accent lingers nicely through the finish.

title: 3000 BC 2009 Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)
description: Pear, apple and lime lead on the nose of this wine, with a secondary glimmer of flint. Rich but not overdone, the palate is fresh, with ripe fruit flavors and lively acidity. A peach pit accent unfolds on the finish; drink now.

title: Artezin 2010 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: A young Zin still in need of time to develop, there's an intensity of raspberry and blackberry fruit in this wine, and a softness throughout. It's full bodied, and its finish falls flat.

title: Windsor Sonoma 2010 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This has orange, pineapple and green apple flavors that are accented by oaky caramel. Balanced with crisp, citrusy acidity, this should pair well with rich shellfish fare. Drink now.

title: Winery of Good Hope 2011 Bush Vine Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)
description: This wine shows good balance between the lively acidity and ripe notes of red apple flesh, pear and orange oil. The round mouthfeel of ripe fruit flavors are lifted on the finish by a tangy, green plum and lime zest accent. Drink now.

title: Zerba Cellars 2008 Dolcetto (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Dolcetto is still a rare sighting in Washington, and the vines that exist are still quite young. Not surprising then that this pleasant red is rather simple, with red fruit flavors and a subtle streak of pepper. The tannins are a little on the stemmy side.

title: Zerba Cellars 2008 Wild Z Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: A “kitchen sink” blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot, the Wild Z shows far more flavors of vanilla and black tea than fruit. A popular style to be sure, fine for everyday drinking.

title: Zull 2011 Lust & Laune Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: In the light style of value Austrian white wine, this is full of crisp, fresh flavors of apple and grapefruit, with just a touch of pepper. Drink now. Screwcap.

title: Josef Weger 2008 Pinot Nero (Alto Adige)
description: There is a touch of sour berry on the bouquet, with white almond and menthol notes. The mouthfeel is subdued and silky.

title: Markus Huber 2011 Hugo Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: This is crisp, clean and light. It is fruity with green apple flavor, and it has a tight texture. The finish is floral and aromatic. Screwcap.

title: Michael Pozzan 2010 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: There is lots of charm in this soft, gentle Pinot Noir. It's not an ager, but it offers some nice cherry, Dr. Pepper and spice flavors.

title: Josef Weger 2010 Lagrein Rosato Rosé (Alto Adige)
description: Pressed from Lagrein grapes native to northern Italy, this bright rosé offers an easy, crisp finish with tones of wild berries, peach and pink grapefruit.

title: Maso Poli 2008 Pinot Nero (Trentino)
description: There's a savory, earthy element to this oak-aged wine, with bright tones of wild berry, cola, balsam and rosemary oil.

title: Babcock 2010 Psi Clone Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Right out of the bottle, this wine smells and tastes tight and unappealing. It's marked by drying tannins and earthiness, giving it a rustic quality. Still, there's a good core of cherry fruit.

title: Cartlidge & Browne 2010 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: Flavors of creamy vanilla pudding, buttered toast and pineapple jam mark this slightly sweet Chardonnay. A crisp streak of acidity provides much needed balance to the richness.

title: Château de Brigue 2010 Signature Red (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is herbal, with some flavors of green bell pepper and wild spice. The wine is light bodied and fruity, with attractive, juicy black-currant flavors and a perfumed aftertaste.

title: Château Montaud 2011 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: A wine with a light texture and character, this is very fresh and crisp. It has flavors of white berries, pears and red plums, with lemon zest acidity.

title: Johanneshof Reinisch 2011 Auslese Rotgipfler (Thermenregion)
description: Brown sugar and dark treacle flavors dominate this rich, sweet wine. With its opulent texture, this is for sipping. Screwcap.

title: Kuleto Estate 2008 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Although there's a lot of ripe blackberry jam, black currant and chocolate flavors, it's a little on the simple side. Ready to drink now.

title: Kuleto Estate 2009 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: This wine has flavors of wild blackberry, blueberry and mocha, with a rich vein of herb, tobacco and spice. However, it's hot in alcohol, and finishes with glyceriney sweetness—almost like a minor Port. Drink up.

title: Les Maîtres Vignerons de Saint-Louis 2011 Estandon Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is a smooth wine, with strawberry fruits and a creamy texture. The wine feels just off dry, making it accessible, warm and ripe. Screwcap.

title: Van Loveren 2011 Chenin No. 5 Chenin Blanc (Robertson)
description: A refreshing and approachable wine, with forward notes of green plum, plantain, Granny Smith apple and lime on the nose and palate. There's a slight roundness to the midpalate, but a vibrant twang lifts the finish.

title: Argiolas 2011 Costamolino  (Vermentino di Sardegna)
description: Delicate tones of stone fruit, lime, talc power and honeydew melon mark the bouquet. It's crisp on the palate, with a touch of wild salvia on the finish.

title: Frenchman's Gulch 2008 Syrah (Washington)
description: Sourced from the excellent Lewis Vineyard, this toasty, chewy Syrah displays black cherry fruit against a strong background of vanilla. At first it seems tart to the point of being almost sour, but as it breathes, the oak mutes some of the acid and balances it out.

title: Gamache 2008 Estate Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Hard and tannic at first, this young wine grudgingly reveals a core of very tart cherry fruit, encased in flavors of stem and wood. A coffee-infused finish does not conceal the chewy, tough tannins.

title: Höpler 2011 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)
description: This has fresh citrus and dried apricot flavors, with Grüner's typical peppery edge. For drinking now. Screwcap.

title: Winzer Krems 2011 Ried Sandgrube Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: This is a light wine, with a white fruit flavor and a taut, mineral character. It is all fruit with layer upon layer of pear and crisp acidity. Drink over the year as it's not meant for aging. Screwcap.

title: Cooper Vineyards 2007 Norton (Virginia)
description: There are just enough plush, woody tannins here to balance the intense boysenberry fruit. Lingering espresso and vanilla flavors infuse the palate while a slightly sharp note of acidity comes through on the medium finish. Try with grilled pork.

title: De Sante 2008 L'Atelier White (Napa Valley)
description: De Sante has struggled with Sauvignon Blanc over the years, and while this blend, with 40% Sémillon, contains some good citrus flavor, it's aggressive in drily sour green pyrazines.

title: Finca Sophenia 2009 Altosur Sauvignon Blanc (Tupungato)
description: Lime and green melon aromas are a bit less than clean and pure, and the palate serves up a pile of jalapeño and bell pepper, with some lime in the background. Short on the finish, and kind of dilute.

title: Gilbert Cellars 2007 Estate Malbec (Wahluke Slope)
description: This vineyard has proven it can ripen good Malbec, but here it seems as if something has gone sideways. There is a gluey scent underneath the blackberry fruit, and the wine seems chalky and disjointed in the mouth, with more of the band-aid flavors in the finish.

title: Vivác Winery 2006 Merlot (New Mexico)
description: Unusual aromas of singe and tar are interspersed with Chinese tea and vanilla while flavors in the mouth turn a bit soupy. Medium-bodied with some grippy tannins and a short finish. Drink now.

title: Vivác Winery 2007 Tempranillo (New Mexico)
description: All vanilla and mocha on the nose followed by pretty raspberry and strawberry fruit on the palate. Smooth, short-to-medium finish with just a touch of spice. Try with grilled lamb.

title: Spann Vineyards 2007 Chardonnay-Viognier (North Coast)
description: Ultraripe in pineapple, tropical fruit and oaky vanilla flavors, this white blend is almost as sweet as a dessert wine. It's fortunately balance with mouthwatering acidity.

title: French Rabbit 2007 Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays d'Oc)
description: Smells a little warm with notes of stewed red berries and brandied cherries. Lightweight with medium acidity and virtually no tannins—this is an easy-to-drink option; given the Tetra-pak packaging, a great choice for concerts, camping and picnics.

title: Cascata 2008 The Professors' Classic Dry Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: Vibrant and youthful, this wine greets the taster with fresh, clean scents of honey, fall flowers and roses. It's medium-bodied and crisp, with a final peach note that fades a bit too quickly. Try with Thai curry. No improvement with age; drink before 2011.

title: Vino dei Fratelli 2008 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)
description: This Pinot Grigio from northern Italy offers an easy aromatic lineup of mature melon, chopped herbs and spring flowers. It's thick and slightly sweet in the mouth with a heavy, fat feel on the close.

title: Berryessa Gap 2006 Reserve Petite Sirah (Yolo County)
description: Tastes and feels rustic in the harshness of the tannins, which hint at unripeness, and the green, minty edge to the blackberries and cola. Ready now.

title: Chateau Chantal 2008 Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Better than in previous years but still brambly and stemmy smelling. The palate is sheer and fairly hollow in the center, with simple buttery raspberry flavors. Shows bits of burnt wood, oil and heat on the finish.

title: Finca Agostino 2007 Agostino Familia Red (Mendoza)
description: Rustic and stemmy, with burnt, nutty aromas leading to a thick palate of stemmy black fruit flavors. Herbal, tannic and stemmy throughout, so at least there's continuity between the nose, palate and finish.

title: Haras 2008 Estate Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)
description: Stemmy, stalky aromas cloud over dilute fruit notes, while the palate is on the acidic side, which causes citrus and pithy peach flavors. More pith on the finish, with a hint of banana. Just o.k., with limited character.

title: O. Fournier 2008 Urban Uco Tempranillo (Uco Valley)
description: Rough and stemmy smelling, and sort of scratchy. The palate is acceptable but that's about it, with creamy, sweet, wayward berry flavors. Finishes medicinal and a bit weedy. Similar in quality to the ‘07 Urban Tempranillo.

title: Santa Ema 2007 Barrel Select Reserve Carmenère (Cachapoal Valley)
description: Opens with generic red fruit and candy aromas, but the palate is overtly acidic, which causes a sourness to go with candied, medicinal berry fruit flavors. After the tartness subsides, there's regular red fruit notes left over.

title: Sweet Valley 2007 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Some wines can hit 15.4% alcohol, as this does, and make it work. But here the burn and scorch from the alcohol simply overwhelms some excellent fruit. Detail is lost, and what's left is a hot, jammy red.

title: Andeluna 2007 Chardonnay (Tupungato)
description: Sort of nutty and oily on the nose, without a whole lot of fruit to speak of. Overoaked for what it is, with a resiny mouthfeel and finish. Too much oak, vanilla and cream for a wine of modest quality.

title: Finca Agostino 2007 ILKA Malbec (Mendoza)
description: A baked, sweet, candied Malbec with a gritty, sugary mouthfeel and sweet, zappy cherry and plum flavors. Hot and breaks down on the finish. Rudimentary.

title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2008 Reserva Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: Herbal, punchy aromas start it off, and the palate has strong acids and rubbery tannins in support of herbal, red fruit flavors that suggest rhubarb. Strains to show much ripeness.

title: Michel Torino 2009 Cuma Malbec (Cafayate)
description: Jammy and dark, with sweet, candied, offbeat aromas. Heavy in the mouth, with baked plum and berry flavors and then a reduced, short finish. Thick almost to the point of cloying. A strange wine.

title: Septima 2009 Chardonnay (Agrelo)
description: Light in color, with stalky aromas that don't feature much fruit. The palate is gentle and bland, with distant orange and tropical fruit. Wheaty and flat on the finish, with an overall canned fruit quality.

title: Canyon Wind 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon (Grand Valley)
description: Initially a bit funky, this wine opened up to offer pretty cassis and fresh blackberry fruit couched in a bed of medium acid and soft tannins. Mushroom and plum tones on the finish hang around for just a bit. Drink up.

title: Twin Islands 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Leafy and nettle-like upfront, but deepening a bit on the palate to show nectarine, grapefruit and tomatillo notes. The only quibble with this medium-bodied white from the winemaker at Nautilus is that it seems almost a little sweet on the finish (the stated residual sugar level is 3 g/L). Drink now.

title: Cave B 2008 Cuvée du Soleil Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A Bordeaux-style blend that is a barrel selection from estate fruit. The tannins are substantial in all the Cave B reds, but particularly so here––thick and astringent to the point of chalky. There is interesting depth and some high-toned red fruits.

title: C&B; 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Tastes as rich and sweet as a dessert pastry, with sweet vanilla oak, raspberry and cherry pie filling and cinnamon spice flavors. Somewhat one-dimensional, but tasty and smooth. Drink now.

title: Chilcas 2009 Reserva Carmenère (Maule Valley)
description: Smells like Italian herbs, dry red fruits and tomato sauce, or in other words, a nice pizza. The palate is a bit tight and astringent for the variety, with cherry, blackberry and licorice flavors. Not super spicy or complex, but still tasty and varietally correct.

title: Clavesana 2008 Il Clou di Clavesana  (Dolcetto di Dogliani)
description: Match this easy wine with brick oven pizza on sourdough crust or juicy grilled sausage. Made with the Dolcetto grape, the wine is loaded with bright fruit tones of blueberry and black cherry and offers a thick, creamy mouthfeel.

title: Crayelle Cellars 2008 Syrah (Washington)
description: Peppery and herbal, with thin, tight veins of wild black fruits. It's an elegant style, with underlying minerality, though weighted toward a European palate.

title: Domaine Foivos 2003 Stalactite  (Muscat of Kefallonian)
description: This Muscat offers luscious honey, lemon and tropical fruit on the nose, with viscous waves of lemon, pineapple and warming spice on the palate. Not overly complex but certainly appealing. Pair with creamy cheeses and fruit.

title: El Roy 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Soft and ripe, made for drinking now for the polished berry-cherry, tobacco, sweet oak and spice flavors. For the price, there's a lot of upscale character.

title: Enrico Serafino 2007 Diauleri  (Nebbiolo d'Alba)
description: This is a silky and soft Nebbiolo with bright berry aromas and simple spice nuances. There's an elegant, feminine quality to this red wine, but it also shows power and determination.

title: Freeman 2009 Ryo-Fu Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Similar to the 2006 vintage, this '09 is rather sweet and candied in new oaky vanilla, buttered toast, honey and caramel flavors. Underneath is plenty of ripe citrus and tropical fruit. The sweetness detracts from what otherwise is a fine, crisp, minerally wine.

title: Il Vino dei Padri 2009 150 Anniversario Ruché (Monferrato)
description: In homage to the 150th anniversary of Italian unification, this elegantly designed bottle sports a bright Italian flag on the label. That celebratory spirit continues thanks to the wine's aromas of sweet cherry, cola and raspberry. Its light consistency means it could be consumed slightly chilled with cod or fish soup.

title: La Spinona 2008 Bricco Faset  (Barbaresco)
description: This is a good portrait of Nebbiolo save for a pungent touch of powder or solvent that distracts from the overall harmony of fruit. Those strong elements are not outside the great boundaries of this important native Italian grape and are more than forgiven in this case.

title: Morgan 2009 Twelve Clones Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: A little off in texture, with a grainy mouthfeel that's part tart acids and part edgy tannins. However, it's lusty in forward cherry and raspberry fruit flavors, and will surely satisfy many Pinotphiles.

title: Noceto 2010 Pinot Grigio (Clarksburg)
description: With an intensity of almond paste and charcuterie at first sniff, this nice Pinot Grigio from the Sangiovese specialists at Vino Noceto is light in color but rich in mouthfeel, with a flowery, apricot flavor. Its finish is smooth and a smidge sweet.

title: Palladino 2005 San Bernardo Riserva  (Barolo)
description: This vintage of Barolo Riserva San Bernardo (a wine that consistently scores in the 90-point range) appears much grittier and more oak-driven than past expressions. Carpentry shop and wood shavings come to the forefront of mature plum and blackberry jam.

title: Pico Maccario 2010 Lavignone  (Barbera d'Asti)
description: Lavignone is a simple but classy Barbera with solid aromas of forest berry, cassis and fresh tobacco leaf. The wine would pair with fried zucchini flowers stuffed with melted mozzarella cheese.

title: Andretti 2009 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: A big Pinot Noir, extracted and thick in cherry and blueberry pie filling, red currant, sandalwood and dusty spice flavors. Delicious, but soft and atypical for a Pinot, lacking some life and charm. Drink now.

title: Benessere 2007 Hollystone-Collins Old Vines Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: Soft and candy sweet, with raspberry and cherry pie filling, raisin, vanilla, cocoa, brown sugar and cinnamon spice flavors. The tannins are lovely and the mouthfeel is bright. If you like your Zins on the sweet side, it's for you.

title: Cameron Hughes 2009 Frunza Merlot (Viile Timisului)
description: Deeply concentrated on the nose with pure black fruit and whiffs of toast and wood, this Merlot packs a lot of bang for the buck. Full bodied and dry, it's mellow but bright, overflowing with cassis and black cherry flavors and a fresh, herbal finish.

title: Feudo Principi di Butera 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sicilia)
description: True to the variety, this expression of Cabernet Sauvignon offers rich layers of dark fruit, prune, chocolate, spice and dried rosemary. The palate is tight, structured and fresh.

title: Foris 2011 Pinot Blanc (Rogue Valley)
description: Aromatic and bracing, this is a fruity mix of lime, nectarine and pink grapefruit. Foris wines are notable for their freshness, purity of fruit and overall immaculate winemaking.

title: Frank Cornelissen NV Contadino 9  (Etna)
description: The ninth edition of Contadino (the fruit is from the 2011 harvest) is made from a wild blend of Nerello Mascalese (70%), Nerello Cappuccio, Alicante Boushet, Uva Francesca, Minella Nera, Minella Bianca and Insolia. The wine shows an amazingly spicy quality that awakens the palate with a sudden jolt, followed by dried fruit, black ash and dried herb notes. The intensity is remarkable.

title: Tasca d'Almerita 2008 Camastra Red (Sicilia)
description: This is a blend of Nero d'Avola and Merlot in almost equal measures. The first varietal offers aromas of red fruit, wild fennel and pistachio. The second grape lends softness and bright cherry flavor. There's a touch of tar and graphite on the close.

title: Tenuta Rapitalà 2010 Nadir Syrah (Sicilia)
description: This opens with loads of milled black pepper, which makes a strong statement. Behind that spicy tone are notes of black fruit, prune, tobacco and leather. Soft cherry and chocolate accents appear on the finish.

title: Tenuta Rapitalà 2011 Tenuta Syrah (Sicilia)
description: Bright, intense and compelling, this Syrah has bold fruit and a soft, velvety mouthfeel. A wine to be consumed at casual and dressy occasions alike.

title: Tenuta Sarno 1860 2011 Sarno 1860  (Fiano di Avellino)
description: Huge floral intensity opens the bouquet of this Fiano di Avellino, with notes of honeysuckle, rose and jasmine that are followed by accents of citrus, pear and a touch of rubber. The finish is creamy and soft.

title: Valle dell'Acate 2009 Il Moro Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)
description: This opens with aromas of blue flower, rose, almond paste, forest berry and sweet spice. The palate offers fresh berry fruit and a compact, streamlined feel.

title: Valle dell'Acate 2011 Il Frappato (Vittoria)
description: Il Frappato delivers loads of zest and bright aromas of berry, chopped mint, cola and ginger. There's a note of black pepper on the palate, followed by some almond bitterness.

title: Bell 2011 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: The same Bell as the well-known Napa Valley winery, Bell extends its reach into Oregon to make this lip-smackingly good Pinot Gris. Gooseberry, melon, kiwi and grapefruit flavors swirl across the tongue, leaving a clean, fresh and very fruity wake. The moderate alcohol is an added bonus.

title: Casa Silva 2009 Los Lingues Gran Reserva Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: As usual for Casa Silva, this Carmenère is foreceful, minty, herbal and spunky on the nose, with a bold fruit aroma. The mouthfeel is robust and juicy, and the flavors run from herbal plum to berry to carob. The finish is herbal, with length and texture.

title: Château Bessan Ségur 2010  Médoc
description: Dense and dark in color, this wine has a black currant flavor. The tannins are ripe and soft, and the texture has a fresh lilt to it from the acidity and fruitiness. Only on the finish do the youthful tannins show, promising medium-term aging.

title: Château Bouissel 2010 Classic Red (Fronton)
description: Made using fruit sourced from vineyards on the highest terrace above the Tarn River, this fruity wine is made to be consumed young. It has a touch of minerality and some firm tannins, but the red berry fruit and flower note is already attractive. A blend of Négrette, Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec.

title: Château de Pizay 2011 Château de Saint Lager  (Brouilly)
description: From the eastern slopes of the hill of Brouilly, this attractive, open and fruity selection shows a fine red-fruit character that's laced with fresh acidity. It has a firm structure, which creates a solid base for the fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Château du Port 2010 Tertre-Perdigous Malbec (Cahors)
description: Soft and already approachable, this is a red-fruited wine, with ripe, well-integrated tannins and juicy acidity. It's round, fruity and ready to drink.

title: Château Laulerie 2010 Comtesse de Ségur  (Montravel)
description: This is herbaceous, but it also has a ripe yellow-fruit character. It is fresh and crisp, with a great depth of flavor. Its bright acidity and tight-textured finish make this a food wine.

title: Château Loudenne 2010  Médoc
description: A classically structured wine, this has a smoky wood flavor that's balanced by a fresh black-currant note. It has a juicy edge, a dark chocolate note and a slight bitterness that should fade. This needs to age for 4–5 years. Château Loudenne is situated by the Gironde estuary.

title: Château Moulin de Clotte 2010  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux
description: Using fruit sourced from a 20-acre vineyard in Castillon, this is dominated by Merlot, with a touch of perfumed Cabernet Franc. It has an age-worthy structure, showing good balance, firm tannins and ripe fruit.

title: Château Thénac 2011 Fleur du Périgord White (Bergerac Sec)
description: The intense herbaceous aroma is softened on the palate by the wine's lemon-curd flavor and smooth texture. Rich with intense fruitiness, this has notes of black currant and pink grapefruit, with bright acidity on the finish.

title: Château Tour des Gendres 2010 Moulin des Dames White (Bergerac Sec)
description: This wine is named after a windmill on the Conti family property. It is rich, with a spicy new-wood flavor. While it has plenty of structure, the acidity is subdued.

title: D'Alessandro 2010 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)
